metadata.description: Collection of orthodontic clinical cases with source citations

cases.title: Klass II Division 1 Malokklusion med Överbett

presentation.chiefComplaint: Patient with protruding front teeth and deep overbite

cases.diagnosis: Skeletal Class II malocclusion with dental compensation, increased overjet and deep bite

treatmentPlan.approach: Growth modification with functional appliance followed by fixed appliances

outcomes.skeletal: ANB reduced to 4 degrees, improved mandibular position
outcomes.dental: Class I molar and canine relationship achieved, overjet reduced to 3mm, normal overbite
outcomes.stability: Excellent stability at 5-year follow-up with good retention compliance

sources.relevance: Treatment approach based on Proffit's guidelines for Class II correction
Evidence for functional appliance effectiveness in Class II treatment
sources.specificFindings: Twin-block shows 2-3mm additional mandibular growth compared to controls

sources.relevance: Retention protocol based on long-term stability studies
sources.specificFindings: Indefinite retention recommended for Class II cases

cases.title: Trängsel i Underkäken med Mild Klass I

clinicalFindings: Class I molar and canine relationship

cases.diagnosis: Class I malocclusion with moderate lower arch crowding and mild upper arch crowding

outcomes.dental: Excellent alignment achieved, Class I relationship maintained, stable occlusion
outcomes.soft tissue: No significant profile changes, maintained lip support
outcomes.stability: Good stability with bonded retainer at 3-year follow-up

sources.relevance: Retention protocol and long-term stability data
sources.specificFindings: Bonded retainers show best stability for lower anterior alignment

sources.relevance: Clear aligner option as alternative treatment modality
sources.specificFindings: Clear aligners effective for mild to moderate crowding cases

cases.title: Öppet Bett med Digitalt Suga

presentation.chiefComplaint: Front teeth don't touch, thumb sucking habit

cases.diagnosis: Anterior open bite secondary to thumb sucking habit with associated tongue thrust and hyperdivergent growth pattern

treatmentPlan.approach: Habit cessation first, then comprehensive orthodontic treatment

outcomes.habitCessation: Thumb sucking stopped within 3 months of habit crib placement
outcomes.biteClosure: 4mm spontaneous closure after habit cessation, 2mm residual open bite treated with orthodontics
outcomes.dental: Complete bite closure achieved, stable Class I occlusion
outcomes.soft tissue: Improved lip competence, normalized tongue posture
outcomes.stability: Good stability at 2-year follow-up with excellent habit control and myofunctional training compliance

sources.relevance: Open bite diagnosis and treatment strategies

sources.specificFindings: 80-90% success rate with habit cribs when combined with behavior modification

sources.relevance: TAD use for posterior intrusion in open bite cases
sources.specificFindings: TADs effective for intrusion of posterior teeth in hyperdivergent patients

sources.relevance: Biological considerations for tooth movement in open bite treatment
sources.specificFindings: Intrusive forces create bone remodeling patterns that support bite closure

cases.notes: Early intervention critical for habit cessation. Myofunctional therapy essential for long-term stability.
